container.heading: Individual Exchange Navigator Certification — Renewal, Reinstatement, Deactivation, and Suspension or Revocation of Certification

section.heading: Term.
section.text: An Individual Exchange navigator certification expires 2 years after the date it is issued unless it is renewed.

para.text: Notice.

At least 60 days before the expiration of an Individual Exchange navigator certification, the Exchange shall notify the Individual Exchange navigator, either directly at the address, including email address, on file with the Exchange, or by contacting the navigator entity by whom the Individual Exchange navigator is employed or engaged, of the expiration date of an Individual Exchange navigator certification.
The notification shall include:
A renewal application;
The date by which the Exchange must receive the renewal application for the renewal to be issued before the certification expires; and
The amount of the renewal fee, if any.
Eligibility for Renewal. An Individual Exchange navigator certification may be renewed for an additional 2-year term if the holder:
Is otherwise entitled to receive Individual Exchange navigator certification, in accordance with the eligibility requirements set forth in COMAR 14.35.02.02;
Files a renewal application on the form provided by the Exchange either by mail or electronically before expiration of the certification;
Pays to the Exchange a renewal fee if permitted by law and in the manner specified by the Exchange; and
Has completed the Exchange annual training and the continuing education requirements under §C of this regulation.
Continuing Education. A certified Individual Exchange navigator shall complete at least 16 hours of Exchange-approved continuing education per renewal term.
Annual Training.
The Exchange shall:
Schedule the Continuing Education Training on an annual basis; and
Notify certified Individual Exchange navigators of the annual training.

A certified Individual Exchange navigator shall complete the annual training, including any examination, within 60 days before the open enrollment period during each year of the certification term, including any renewal term.

section.heading: Reinstatement.
section.text: In order to obtain a reinstatement of an Individual Exchange navigator certification, the applicant shall submit to the Exchange an application as required under COMAR 14.35.02.03.

para.text: An Individual Exchange navigator shall provide evidence satisfactory to the Exchange of employment or engagement by a navigator entity before the navigator may become certified.
The Exchange may deactivate an individual’s Individual Exchange navigator certification whenever the:
Individual fails to complete the annual training;
Individual has not provided evidence satisfactory to the Exchange of employment or engagement by a navigator entity, as set forth under §A of this regulation; or
The Exchange is informed, either by the individual or a navigator entity, that the individual is not employed or engaged by the navigator entity.
If certification is deactivated due to reasons listed under §B(2) or (3) of this regulation, the Exchange may waive the fees listed under Regulation .02B(3) of this chapter.

section.heading: Suspension or Revocation.
section.text: The Commissioner may suspend or revoke an Individual Exchange navigator certification for the reasons listed under Insurance Article, §31-113(l)(1), Annotated Code of Maryland.

annotations.annotation: Insurance Article, §§31-106 and 31-113, Annotated Code of Maryland
